frame.name: Importing
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Importer</fen> receives <fen>Goods</fen> from an <fen>Exporting_area</fen>, across a boundary or border to a different area, the <fen>Importing_area</fen>. The <fen>Path</fen> along which the <fen>Goods</fen> pass may also be indicated.
<ex><fex name="Importer">The U.S.</fex> <t>imported</t> <fex name="Goods">some wheat</fex> <fex name="Time">in the period</fex>, although it exported about ten times as much.</ex> <ex><fex name="Importer">We</fex> <t>import</t> <fex name="Goods">most of the Tahitian seashells</fex> <fex name="Path">through Japan</fex>.</ex> <ex><t>Importation</t> <fex name="Goods">of wildlife</fex> has gotten more difficult. <fex name="Importer">INI</fex> <fex name="Importing_area">INI</fex> <fex name="Exporting_area">INI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Importer
FE.definition: <def-root>The conscious entity, generally a person, that brings the <fen>Goods</fen> into the <fen>Importing_area</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Vehicle
FE.definition: <def-root>A mobile entity directed by the <fen>Importer</fen> that holds the <fen>Goods</fen> and moves them along from the <fen>Exporting_area</fen> to the <fen>Importing_area</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Importer</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Importer</fen> that accomplishes the action indicated by the target. </def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The items of value whose location is changing.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Importer</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.
<ex>Some department stores <t>import</t> expensive items <fex name="Purpose">to please their higher-paying customers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that explains the <fen>Importer</fen>'s importation of the <fen>Goods</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Importer</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the state of a participant during the action <ex>Kazakhstan <t>imported</t> the petroleum, <fex name="Depictive">unaware of its own reserves</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Importing_area
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Importing_area</fen> is the place that the <fen>Goods</fen> end up as a result of motion.
</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Path</fen> identifies the location of the <fen>Goods</fen> during transit, i.e. after leaving the <fen>Exporting_area</fen> and before reaching the <fen>Importing_area</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Exporting_area
FE.definition:
<def-root>The place where the <fen>Goods</fen> are initially, before the being moved.
</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative instance of the importing event , and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar importing events.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> is the final state of the <fen>Goods</fen> when brought into the <fen>Importing_area</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE applies to participants who derive a benefit from the occurrence of the act of importation.
<ex>The United States <t>imported</t> protein bars <fex name="Beneficiary">for backpackers and hikers</fex>. </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: importation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of moving goods into an area.

lexUnit.name: import.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bring (goods or services) into a country from abroad.

lexUnit.name: import [act].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or process of importing.

lexUnit.name: import [entity].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an imported commodity, article, or service.
